statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: GREAT ALASKA SHOOTOUT AT ANCHORAGE AK

article.headline: Pacific 71, UMKC 70
article.story: ANCHORAGE, Alaska (AP) -- Steffan Johnson scored 17 points, including 13 in the last 5:11, as Pacific defeated Missouri-Kansas City 71-70 Wednesday in the first round of the Carrs/Safeway Great Alaska Shootout. Johnson hit a pair of free throws with 1:12 remaining to give the Tigers a 71-67 lead. Tim Blackwell cut it to one with a 3-pointer for UMKC with 41.4 seconds left. Pacific ran down the time but was called for a shot-clock violation with 5.9 seconds remaining. The Kangaroos took the ball out under their own basket but Quinton Day stepped out of bounds as he drove down the sideline with .5 seconds remaining. UMKC (2-2)led 29-26 after a seesaw first half. A 13-6 run fueled by three 3-pointers by Day gave UMKC a 58-48 lead with 9:08 remaining. The Tigers (2-1) chipped away, mostly at the free throw line, where they finished 18-for-23. Anthony Brown's basket with 1:40 broke a 67-67 tie and gave Pacific the lead for good. Brown finished with 19 points and 14 rebounds. Brent Stephens led UMKC with 26 points and shot 9-for-12 from the field, mostly medium-range jumpers with a defender in his face, along with a pair of contested 3-pointers. Day added 22 points, with 17 in the second half, including five 3-pointers.
